Posts.Content: Hey Londonlass xxx just catching up on your post...... I'm so sorry you've been feeling so low and in pain. Some doctors are just too de sensitised (can't spell) but when it comes to any serious illness they need to sort themselves out!!! Bloody hell!!!! Many years ago (when cancer was never in the picture) it was only when I cried that my GP took me seriously!! It's just not on!  Anyway SORRY I just think you are such a lovely lady that (as many others have said) is so kind to everyone and I'm feeling mad with the way you were treated. Anyway I'm glad the last person took you seriously and you have some new medication now. Really hope it helps xxxxxxx thinking of you xxx
Posts.Title: How to make GP understand that I'm struggling?

Posts.Content: LondonLass Well a little update, last night I woke up once! I slept from midnight to 4.15 and then went straight back to sleep until 7.25!!!! Which is amazing for me! I'm not going to count my chickens yet.....but fingers firmly crossed   Yeyyy! That's great :-) xxxx  Ps always having a 'wobble' lol xxxx
Posts.Title: How to make GP understand that I'm struggling?

Posts.Content: I'm so sorry for all this extra crap you are going through Londonlass!! You do not need it at all!!  I don't have much faith in my BCN really either but lieing like yours is terrible!  Here if you need me xxxx
Posts.Title: So now my BCN is lying to my face...............

Posts.Content: Hope you feel better soon Fiona. Easier said than done I know. You look amazing so please believe that.  Chemo has a lot to answer for!!! You need a mini break or something after your radiotherapy xxxxx ((hugs))
Posts.Title: A bit of a ramble....and a thank you!

Posts.Content: It's so horrible waiting!! I am waiting for my operation results and what treatment I will be having. I've still got a couple of weeks to go yet too!  Treat yourself with some retail therapy! I'm going to soon when I'm healed a bit more.  Do you mind me asking what type of cancer do you have?  Xx
Posts.Title: THE WAITING !!!

Posts.Content: Hey Sarah xx before I got my cancer lump I had a terrible rash all over my body, one that I had never had before and was extremely tired too. I'm glad now that I got my rash as it meant that I was extra careful with how I showered and applied products. Then I found the lump! Devastating but had the rash not been there, I might not have found the lump until weeks later.  I'm starting my chemo this Friday and I feel shattered today. Must be the anxiety of it all xxx
Posts.Title: Dizzy and fatigued
